instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: This board was working fine, it had problems with the ram, I reflowed it and it worked fine for a couple months, now it came with a short on <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL> and nowhere to be found I removed all the ram chips and can´t seem to find anyshort... don´t know where to look now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Which is the exact ohm value (not diode) for that short?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
0.1 ohm is pure short.
You should get at least 0.3-0.5 ohm, counting probes resistance; did you discount that value?

You can try injecting voltage, starting with 0.5V; no more than 2V.
You may need 20A PSU.
5A model does not help in this case...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I don´t have access to a 20A PSU nothing to do in that case?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Short on <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Nobody stop you to try with 5A PSU.
Just try, may have luck; set amp limit to max first...
